New Records: India won their second T20 World Cup, and their first World Cup in 13 years in any type of cricket.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli played a key role in India's eventual win over South Africa, scoring a half-century in his final T20 World Cup game.
Jasprit Bumrah threw a ball that resulted in an out, contributing to South Africa's falter.
Suryakumar Yadav made a stunning catch from David Miller, taking him out of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts may not have predicted India as the favorites given South Africa's strong performance, but India's team captain Rohit Sharma emphasized their determination to win.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win.
Virat Kohli announced that this was his last time playing in the T20 World Cup, and that it was a fitting end to his career.
Aiden Markram said that his team was 'gutted' but 'incredibly proud' of their performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was South Africa's first time playing in the final of an international cricket competition.
India's win marked the end of a 13-year drought in the global cricket arena.
The game was a nail-biter, with South Africa just seven runs behind in the end.
Others: Cricket is the world's second-most popular sport, but many Americans are unfamiliar with it.
T20 is an abbreviated form of the game, with each team having 20 overs.
